orgs.name: 624 OC
orgs.mission: Receives orders and tasks from U.S. Cyber Command and tasks 24th AF subordinate units to perform a wide range of cyber missions in support of Air Force and Joint Force Commanders. Operates the C3MS weapon system.
orgs.key_words: C3MS, Tasks from U.S. Cyber Command

children.name: 688 CW
children.mission: Premier cyberspace wing dedicated to delivering innovative, game-changing and integrated cyberspace, Information Operations, engineering and infrastructure capabilities to assure National, Joint and Air Force success.

children.name: 26 COG
children.mission: Present combat mission ready cyberspace operators to operate, maintain, and defend the Air Force's cyberspace domain. One of two 688 CW groups with CWOs.

children.name: 26 NOS
children.mission: Provide premier mission assurance for Air Force core missions through persistent DCO and DODIN operations via the employment of the AFINC cyberspace weapon system and the JRSS.

children.name: 33 NWS
children.mission: Provide effects for the Air Force, in, through, and from cyberspace, by employing synchronized cyberspace defense operations to detect, respond to, and prevent cyberspace intrusions. Uses the ACD weapon system.

children.name: 68 NWS
children.mission: Employ mission-ready intelligence professionals who use the CDA weapon system to execute DCO to provide data loss vulnerability assessments, force protection analysis, network vulnerability reporting, and information damage assessments for all Air Force operations, missions, and functions across the AFIN.
children.key_words: CDA weapon system, data loss vulnerability assessments

children.name: 690 COG
children.mission: Provide integrated network operations for USCYBERCOM, 24 AF-AFCyBER, and 67 CW. Delivers Air Force network operations, network management, information assurance, Enterprise IT services, and Enterprise Service Desk support. One of two 688 CW groups with CWOs.

children.name: 690 ISS
children.mission: Provide communications support for classified and intelligence networks on Lackland Air Force Base, Port San Antonio, and Medina Annex. Provides network core services, information assurance, Help Desk, and classified IT requirements management.

children.name: 690 NSS
children.mission: Provide tactical control of units conducting AFCYBER operations to ensure mission assurance for the full spectrum Air Force mission and the development of Airmen as cyberspace operators. Home to the AMAC, which supports the CSCS weapon system.
children.key_words: Home to the AMAC, CSCS weapon system, full-spectrum

children.name: 83 NOS
children.mission: Provide centralized cyberspace defense and mission assurance using the CSCS cyberspace weapon system to perform DCO and DODIN operations across the Air Force enterprise network.
children.key_words: CSCS weapon system, DCO, DODIN ops

children.name: 561 NOS
children.mission: Provide mission assurance to the warfighter by operating, sustaining, and defending the Air Force enterprise network.

children.name: 690 COS
children.mission: Operate, sustain, and defend the AFIN, employing the CSCS cyberspace weapon system to assure global cyberspace supremacy, enforce network standards, and develop Airmen as cyberspace warriors.

children.name: 691 COS
children.mission: Deliver global, integrated cyberspace capabilities and effects by employing the CSCS weapon system to assure global cyberspace supremacy and mission assurance.
children.key_words: CSCS weapon system, global cyberspace supremacy

children.name: 38 CEIG
children.mission: Plan, engineer, and deliver a survivable and resilient infrastructure to establish the cyberspace domain and enable the Air Force to conduct net-centric offensive and defensive air, space, and cyberspace operations.

children.name: 38 ES
children.mission: Plan, engineer, implement, assess and restore Air Force cyber capabilities throughout the cyberspace domain by baselining, planning, designing, establishing, optimizing and/or replacing cyber weapon systems.

children.name: 38 CONS
children.mission: Provide innovative acquisition solutions which result in full-spectrum support of the global cyberspace domain.

children.name: 38 CYRS
children.mission: Deliver long-haul communications services and cyber systems management for the Air Force and joint warfighter success

children.name: 85 EIS
children.mission: Rapidly deploy worldwide to engineer and install world-class capabilities enabling air, space and cyberspace dominance.

children.name: 67 CW
children.mission: Employs cyberspace forces to enable freedom of action to operate, defend, and attack in and through the cyberspace domain. The premier tactical cyberspace warfighting wing.

children.name: 318 COG
children.mission: Drive cyberspace innovation to optimize existing weapon systems and cyberspace capabilities to shape operational employment to CMFs that evolve cyberspace force development to meet current and future force needs.
children.key_words: optimize weapon systems, evolve cyberspace force development

children.name: 39 IOS
children.mission: Provide initial qualification training to Airmen to plan and execute mission requiring cyberspace operations and information operations capabilities.

children.name: 346 TS
children.mission: Conduct independent, credible, and rigorous operational test and evaluations, emissions, security tests, and other specialized tests of cyberspace capabilities and operate Air Force Space Coloradommand's cyberspace test and training range to enhance the military utility of cyberspace.

children.name: 90 COS
children.mission: Expeditiously integrate, innovate, and deploy cyberspace capabilities to achieve priority mission objectives in and through air, space, and cyberspace.

children.name: 567 COG
children.mission: Plans and executes cyberspace operations to assist a supported commander to fight in and through a contested, friendly cyberspace environment.

children.name: 833 COS
children.mission: Present, plan, and execute cyberspace operations to defend national information networks against cyberspace threats. Defends national cyberspace key terrain

children.name: 834 COS
children.mission: Postured to provide rapid, tailored, defensive mission assurance to USSTRATCOM and USNORTHCOM global operations

children.name: 835 COS
children.mission: Protect critical Air Force and DOD infrastructure and mission systems by providing AFCYBER and CCDRs a mobile precision protection capability to identify, pursue, and mitigate cyberspace threats

children.name: 836 COS
children.mission: Present, plan, and execute cyberspace operations to defend national information networks against cyberspace threats. Presents forces to the CNMF, which is responsible for defending national networks against cyberspace threats

children.name: 837 COS
children.mission: Composed of three cyberspace protection teams postured to provide rapid, tailored defensive mission assurance to USTRANSCOM operations.

children.name: 92 COS
children.mission: To assure Air Force and Department of Defense missions through the employment of CPTs, CVAs, and CSAs. The only Air Force unit conducting CVAs.

children.name: 67 COG
children.mission: Provide Forces to conduct effective Air Force network attack, network support, and communications security of Air Force units. Focused on the priorities of the Air Force Network Operations commander, CDRUSSTRATCOM, and supported unified CCDRs. The offensive arm of the Air Force.

children.name: 91 COS
children.mission: Execute offensive cyberspace operations, as tasked by USCYBERCOM, in support of worldwide CCDR objectives. Conducts telephone and information systems cyberspace operations.

children.name: 315 COS
children.mission: Execute cyberspace attack and C-ISR to provide global strike, intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance. Develops, integrates, and employs cyber-minded Airmen and capabilities in support of joint force commanders and national requirements.

children.name: 390 COS
children.mission: Conduct operations that manipulate the cyberspace domain to enable CCDRs the ability to perform Global Strike and C-ISR

children.name: 352 COS
children.mission: Provide world-class offensive cyberspace operations Airmen to USCYBERCOM in support of United States Indo-Pacific Command and National Priorities
